man y moons ago – c ounting on

2 The element of designexium is a _____________ for the future.

7 Match the idioms with It’s meaning below
1. One mans trash, another ones treasure A) A problem which only a small part of it can be seen or solved
2. Blind as a bat B) To lie down and relax
3. The tip of an Iceberg C) A person who can’t see well or properly
D) try to do something extremely hard or complex , therefore can’t 4. Recharge your batteries succeed
5. Bite more than you can chew E) Entering to things without having a plan
F) something not special for someone, but considered special for 6. Play things by ear someone else

Why is the moon dark sometimes? Discuss with your friends.

7 Read the passage and answer the questions
ANY SIGN OF LIFE
‘Luxury’ the space shuttle of Mercury, arrived to Venus for the first time. It is as big as a double decker. It started moving around and made a quick cruise .It examined the rocks, sand and atmosphere which can provide Information to scientists on earth.
The samples and photos were taken from the surface. The area was searched gently and carefully. Luxury has a wide camera system which can record all the data up to 48 hours.
The scientists are claiming that the samples will tell more when they start to analyze them in the laboratory. Most of them were carried in flasks and test tubes. They are also defending that
some magnetic substances need to be investigated in universities. They were found in Mercury too, which have magnetic fields.
Luxury will continue to seek some more Information about Venus and if there is any sign of
oxygen or land that can be lived on.
Answer TRUE or FALSE.
1 Samples were taken to the laboratory.
2 Luxury is big as a station.
3 There are magnetic fields on Venus.
4 They are signs of oxygen on Venus.
22

9 Circle the correct meaning of the idioms
Take your courage in both hands 1 A)To investigate something dangerous enough to succeed B) Enough to do something
C) To finish something very dangerous D) To start something very dangerous
2 Reach the stars A) Have a lot of questions about something B) Have high hate for something
C) Have high love for something D) Have high aims about something
3 Make a fuss A) Talk about something, more of a complain B) Talk about something, more of a regret
C) Talk about anger management D) Talk about love and friendship
Leave no stone unturned 4 A) Leave no space in the area B) An easy task to accomplish
C) Try everything to accomplish your task D) End your task as soon as possible
5 Houston we have a problem A) Reporting charges B) Reporting someones fault
C) Reporting massive ideas D) Reporting a massive problem
24

29

7 There is a passage about layers of earth. Read the Information below to answer the questions.
STRUCTURE OF THE EARTH The earth has three layers. The first layer is called a core. The core is in the center of the earth. The solid core (inner core) is made mostly from iron. The temperature of the core can increase up to 13.00 Fahrenheit. (7200 degrees celsius). The heat on the surface made iron melt. The melted core is called liquid or outer core.
The outer cores duty is to create a magnetic field to hold the earth. Without the outer core, earth can be destroyed by the sun because of no protection to the light thats coming from it.
The mantle is around the core. It is thick up to 1.800 miles (2.900 km) Rocks and heavy substances make up this layer. Some of the rocks are melted here too.
The mantle is a liquid rock under the ocean. The outer layer is the crust. This layer is also made of rock but lighter than the mantle. It is 5 to 25 miles (8 to 40km) thick. There is life on earths crust.
The crust is also broken in plates. The plates move constantly. Continents are on the plates. It is called continental drift.
Crust can be categorized into two parts. Oceanic crust and continental crust. Oceanic crust is called Sima. Sima is the smallest part of the earth which is 6 miles. Because of volcanic activities, oceanic layer gets affected and creates islands.
Answer TRUE or FALSE.
1 The crust is also broken in plates.
2 The mantle is a liquid rock under the sun.
Crust can be categorized into two parts. Oceanic crust and 3 Rock crust.
4 The earth has three layers.
5 The melted core is called liquid or freezing core.
31
